review_text:
I have yet to receive the item and have no idea how to track it. It was handed over to a secondary delivery service that was unnamed on the 4th of November 2021. I have not been provided  information to track it and I am not sure I am ever going to receive it.

Edit: I did finally receive the item. For anyone not aware if the post office hands the package off to another delivery service you have to contact the person who sent the package for the information. I did contact the seller and was referred back to the post office. Hopefully if it happens again in the future the next customer will get a more prompt response. The Torc is beautiful and looks to be a a good quality.

item_title: Fire steel / Viking era - [16 Feuer-S 1 / H1 C-2]
review_text:
I bought this third flint striker from PeraPeris just out of curiosity and an urge to experiment with it. As always, It was nicely wrapped and fast shipped from Germany (8 days). It is a full size striker, 4" in length, and an ample loop for user who has large finger size. My fingers are relatively small, however I still feel it firm in my hand, so I can say there is not any problem at all as far as ergonomic feature is concerned.

The most interesting part that first draws my attention is the thickness of its shining striking face, at least it is 7 mm thick, and to my astonishment and surprising pleasure, it greatly enhanced the sparkling performance. Using a flake of Texas flint, and with just some slight strikes, showers of far flung bright sparks happened.

Great Item! Great seller!

item_title: Fire steel / Roman era - [16 Feuer-S 4 / H1 C-2]
review_text: This is the second full-size flint striker, same design, I bought from PeraPeris. It arrived sooner than the first one, only 8 days from Germany, and was nicely wrapped in fine protective carton envelop. I keep it intact as an addition to my collection. Everything is fine with this product, from design, to material quality, ergonomic feature and its great performance!

review_text: Love it! Product was exactly as described, shipped quickly and arrived in perfect condition. It takes some practice but once you get the technique the noise it makes is really cool! Highly recommend this shop :)

Gothic spear pendant - [0 Spear-Kow]
review_text:
Lovely item. Crisp casting with wonderful detail.   This item is a pendant made in the style of an actual spearhead from Kovel, Ukraine, found in 1858, and lost during WW2. 
It has one of the most important runic inscriptions in the corpus on it. This pendant is a lovely way to preserve a piece of lost archaeology. 

Nb.  Prompt dispatch, well packaged. Great service as always.

item_title: Anglo-Saxon Scabbard Mount  - [07 MB Angel ]
review_text:
Really beautiful item. A stunningly crisp casting and well worth having.

The design is adapted from the famous Chessel Down throat, although this features a cut down version of the zoomorphic frieze (outermost motifs are cut from this design) and is the same on both sides, whereas the original had a very crude silver sheet to form the back, with runes scratched in. This is a rather lovely adaptation of the style represented by the Chessel Down sword. 

However, it is quite a small piece and likely in most cases will not be compatible with replica Anglo-Saxon sword blades, for use as a scabbard fitting. If you want to use this piece with a sword, be sure to check the measurements thoroughly!!  

Nb.  Prompt dispatch, well packaged, superb service as always.

item_title: Viking sword chape "Valleberga" - [07 OB Valle]
review_text: This is a really nice chape made of real 10% tin bronze. I took it to the Icelandic national museum where there is a bunch of very similar chapes and this one compares very well to the originals. Cannot recommend this item highly enough. One thing to keep in mind is that the sides of this chape are 'V' shaped while most original chapes' edges were were 'U' shaped. This is not a problem with a sharp sword where the scabbard has a'<>' shaped blade channel but I bought this chape for a reenactment sword which has flat 3mm edges and a rectangular blade channel so I had to shave the wooden scabbard core to within a couple of millimetres of the blade channel corners which makes the wood core weak. If you are buying this for a blunt sword make the wooden core 5-7 cm longer so you don't have to weaken the wooden core as much.

item_title: Forged Viking neck knife - [02 M-Fing Eis/H1 D-3]
review_text:
craftsmanship that should embarrass us all for buying a knife off the shelf. so well done i'm not sure which you put first, form or function. thank you for not gouging us, though i must say it's worth more than i paid for it.

thank you

review_text:
This is, I believe, the ninth piece of jewelry I've gotten from PeraPeris - as always, it does not disappoint. A charming and faithful reproduction of the Uppland pendant. 

My one issue with this piece, if I had one, would be that there is no designated loop to thread a string or chain through; one must thread the string or chain through the circle of the figure's horns, which sometimes prevents the pendant from sitting flat against the chest. This is a minor issue and does not detract from my satisfaction with the item.

item_title: Roman Belt with - [10 R√∂m-K 3:A]
review_text: This belt was my second Pera Peris purchase and I am very pleased.  The combination of dark brown leather with a brass buckle is very attractive and is a perfect accessory for khaki, tan, or brown trousers.  The belt is also available in a black leather/silver buckle combination, which I purchased several months ago.  The workmanship of this product is excellent, and I consider these belts appropriate for wear with dress and casual attire alike.  My favorite feature of this belt is Pera Peris's interpretation of the iconic First Century AD Roman legionnary buckle, updated and adapted for modern everyday use.  Overall, I am extremely well satisfied with my belts and will not hesitate to buy additional Pera Peris merchandise in the future!

review_text: The knife is exactly as described. It shipped the same day I placed the order on the 21st of December but due to issues that had nothing to do with the seller it only got to me on the 11th of January. All in all, the knife is bigger in size than what I expected; the leather is of very good quality and sturdy. The sheath came with a scratch of around 1.5-2cm on the front side; I was a bit disappointed initially but I realized it kinda adds to the authenticity of the item - even though it was not intended. All in all, great item, great purchase, great seller. Will come back for more.

item_title: Roman-Germanic Fibula replica - 07 Fi Krpo
review_text:
I can't say enough nice things about Peer. I ordered two of these brooches for my daughter, along with a bag for myself. I left enough time for them to arrive for Christmas... But not a lot extra. The package arrived in good time... But it only had one brooch! 

I was in a bit of a panic, but I emailed Peer. It took him a day or two to get back, but when he did, he was very friendly, and promised to send the second brooch in time for Christmas. 

It's December 23rd, and I just picked it up from the post office! 

The product is lovely, and the service was outstanding. I would (and probably will!) buy from him again with confidence.

item_title: Knife blades made of Damascus Steel - 02 blade damask 1
review_text:
I'm a Knife maker and It is very hard to find well made Damascus blades.
This Blade is made out of Very thick steel, making it very sturdy and making it useful for just about anything Bushcraft.
The Bevels and Angles were near perfect and it resembles a Scandy grind. It arrived very sharp and I decided to make a handle just as beautiful as the blade.

For more knife products visit my Facebook page "F-Knives" and you can see a video on how I made the handle.

Thank you very much once again for supplying quality and affordable blades.

item_title: Iron age belt with hand forged belt-hook-buckle - [10 Ei-G 5 Kelt]
review_text:
The belt and buckle are really first rate. The only fly in the ointment is that it comes at 135 c.m. I emailed the company to ask to have the belt lengthened if they would, It‚Äôs not that the belt won‚Äôt fit( but it is cutting it close.) I just prefer the 148 c.m belt for the way it hangs. At any rate, I was told; ‚ÄúNo problem‚Äù..I said Great!! Thank you Very much!
The belt arrived, and it was a 135c.m. And no response from email, when I tried to contact the seller. When before the lines of communication had been open. Disappointed at that level. But if you ask for the standard length, there should be no problem on that level. To any who plan to buy one, ( and I give no caveats against doing so). I would email often concerning whatever change deviating from the standard length that you have requested. All and all, good work,

review_text: Love owning just two forks, a wooden one and now this one, which I use for potlucks. There is something nice about using one, and keeping life simple. review_text:
I really love this piece,it is light weight and flexible enough to easily take off and on, but definitely not flimsy like so many other sellers make, nor is it over heavy or hard to wear/bend. I will definitely buy from them in the future.
 I really can only think of one thing I would change, and that would be to have smaller diameter ones for women's necks, as mine is a little bit big in that regard. It's not really a big issue and will vary per person, but may be something for the creator to consider in the future. 
Just for reference I am 5'10" tall and average weight Dutch and Danish woman ..ie not small or petite  but not overweight. Basically I know that there are many women that are smaller than us Nordic/Germanic ladies. 
 ps: I didn't give it all stars as I like to save one for one of a kind or very high quality items.

review_text:
Miraculous!...

Easy to apply, preserves the texture and colour of metal, appears to be safe for even the softer gemstones, and since I applied it to my silver jewellery, haven't seen a hint of tarnish (and usually, my silver starts visibly tarnishing again within a few days of being cleaned, even if it hasn't been worn)!

I was hopeful, but not convinced of the claims made for this product when I bought this, but so far, I am a believer. If it lasts as long as it claims (or even half as long), then it will be well worth the price.

Also, great communication from the seller, who has been very patient with my frequent messages for shipping updates, etc. A pleasure to do business with.

Thank you for making it available!

review_text:
Fantastic craftmanship and very well made. It's actually wider and thicker than I expected. The only thing would warn other buyers about is is that the needle is quite thick and not suitable for very fine-weave cloaks like mine as it left a decent hole. If it was thinner and sharper I dont believe this would be a problem.
 A thicker, more loosely woven wool cloak is better suited to such a heavy-duty brooch.

Overall, I'm very happy with the item and would recommend purchasing.

item_title: Forged Viking neck knife - [02 M-Fing Eis / H3 A-0]
review_text:
My opinion of this neck dagger is very high, I had previously purchased one from peraperis before, AND I LOVED IT but it was lost due to unforeseen circumstances, I lost the name of the shop when I recreated my profile and I decided to get one of similar design from grimfrost, however I didn't like it nearly as much since it was made of solid irons because it was meant to be historically accurate and therefore (to me) less functional.
I finally got sick of it and gave it away and looked all over for the online shop AND I FOUND IT (thank goodness)
This is my favorite little dagger and I use it for so many things :D
I will be buying another for my boyfriend soon :)
Thank you so much, love from America
Ryder from Colorado

Ring Brooch "Ireland" - [07 Fi Irland/ N1 D-6]
review_text: This small penannular brooch replicates an artifact found in Ireland.  I've read that the penannular was created by the Celts and later adopted by the Romans and the Vikings.  I find it useful in place of buttons on hand-knit items like cardigans and shawls.  This brooch from PeraPeris is perfect to secure a light shawl or scarf.  It's not large but will fit through two layers of fabric.
